Part_I_Foundations.description: Philosophical and structural foundations of the volatility framework.

sections.mission: Clarify the distinction between short-term sentiment pricing and long-term structural repricing, and show how regime shifts activate the weighing machine.
Demonstrate how narratives follow volatility and price action rather than cause them, and why structure must be separated from story.
Frame markets as adaptive systems that continuously reprice risk, growth, and liquidity under changing macro constraints.

sections.section: Why volatility cycles require a story
sections.mission: Explain why volatility regimes need coherent narratives to become sustainable and psychologically anchored.
Establish volatility as the core structural force driving price behavior rather than price itself.
Differentiate between mechanical short-term cycles and structural macro regime shifts.
Contrast dealer-driven hedging flows with macro narrative shifts to clarify their different impacts.
Identify the conditions under which mechanical flows fail due to macro regime or tail events.
Explain how controlled downside drift suppresses volatility while gradually repricing assets.
Show how one-sided positioning removes liquidity and destabilizes market function.
Describe range-bound behavior combined with structural downside bias.
Analyze how institutional intervention suppresses crash dynamics in modern markets.
Explain how suppression of tail risk reduces distribution curvature while embedding future instability.
